sudoku

Class SudokuBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • sudoku.SudokuBoard

  • public class SudokuBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    The sudoku board. The board itself is a basic integer array. The board also maintains static lists of peers and units for fast repeated access. This doesn't allow for multiple size boards in one instance.

      • getPeers

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getPeers(int x,
                                        int y)
        Returns the set of peers to the point (x,y). The peers are those cells which (x,y) cannot be the same value as.
        Parameters:
        x - row index
        y - column index
        Returns:
        set of cell index peers to (x,y)

      • getPeers

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getPeers(int cell)

      • getPeers

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getPeers(java.awt.Point point)

      • getUnits

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getUnits(int x,
                                                         int y)
        Returns a 2d list of units the cell belongs to. Similar to peers, except each list is the entire list of cells in a particular constraint. For example, at (0,0) the units are: [0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8] row [0,9,18,27,36,45,54,63,72] column [0,1,2,9,10,11,18,19,20] box
        Parameters:
        x - row index
        y - column index
        Returns:
        list of units this cell belongs to

      • getUnits

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getUnits(int cell)

      • getUnits

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getUnits(java.awt.Point point)

      • getOptions

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getOptions(int x,
                                          int y)
        Determines the candidates for the cell (x,y)
        Parameters:
        x - row index
        y - column index
        Returns:
        the list of all possible values that can sit in (x,y)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Translates this board into a string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string representation of the board

      • fromString

        public void fromString(java.lang.String sudoku)
        Parses a SudokuBoard.toString() into a SudokuBoard. Two possible String formats are accepted, one is a result of toString(). The other is a String of digits if the size is less than 10, with gives as the numbers, and 0 or any non number as non givens. Example 4x4: ....1234........
        Parameters:
        sudoku - a result of SudokuBoard.toString() to copy into this

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns true if the object sent is a board and it contains the same values as this board.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - the object to test
        Returns:
        true if o is a Board and they represent the same sudoku
